intro: Myrsine brevis, commonly known as the short-leaved myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Myrsine brevis is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
